intro: Securidaca lamarckii, commonly known as the African cowberry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygalaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow or greenish-yellow flowers that are often fragrant, and it bears small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Securidaca lamarckii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in woodland and savanna habitats.
